result.execSummary:
The defendant Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court would consider early termination of probation after 6 months if all conditions have been met.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Obtain a valid drivers license within the first 5 months of probation.  Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week)

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. As an alternative to payment the defendant may complete community service as approved by the Agent.  Each hour of community service to equal $25 towards financial obligations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:43 PM Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee did not appear.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Attorney Menden advises the defendant is ill and could not come today. 
Defense requests an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:47 AM Defendant Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Brejcha states the the charges were missed charged and will file an amended complaint to charge as a misdemeanor.
Attorney Menden requests to place the matter on the Trial Court for plea/sentencing.
The Court will adjourn the matter to the Trial Court and will toll time limits.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Eryn M Menden
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

03:22 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee appeared by video means.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defendant states she is eligible for public defender representation.    Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:09 PM Defendant Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The defendant states she may qualify for Public Defender Representation as she recently lost her job.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

From defendant requesting an adjournment. 
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 03-09-2022
Request for adjournment is Denied. Not timely and no reason given. Has not returned paperwork for court appointed attorney.
Defendant may appear via Zoom.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

ADDRESS INFO for Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee
Current: 7424 Franklin Ave #2, Middleton, WI 53562   (Effective: 02-28-2022)
Prior: 7424 Franklin Ave #2, Middleton, WI 53562

02:32 PM Defendant Myonda Joy Wilborn McAfee in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
